posts.title: MQTT Broker and MQTT Client Explained
posts.content: Mosquitto is a popular MQTT Broker for Home Assistant and is used for communication by many IoT devices, including Tasmota, Shelly and many more. I explain how MQTT works, some of it's important settings and typical uses. MQTT is a messaging based communication system with one broker and many clients connecting to that broker to exchange information. MQTT Broker Benchmark: https://www.emqx.com/en/blog/open-mqtt-benchmarking-comparison-mqtt-brokers-in-2023 Victron Venus OS Docs: https://www.victronenergy.com/live/open_source:start Mikrotik MQTT Documentation: https://help.mikrotik.com/docs/display/ROS/MQTT 00:00 Intro 01:20 MQTT Brokers - Mosquitto, RabbitMQ & HiveMQ 02:05 Tasmota Open Source Firmware for ESP8266 & ESP32 Devices 02:50 Shelly Devices - Built-in MQTT Support 03:32 Victron & MQTT - CerboGX, Multiplus II, Charge Controllers etc 05:03 Blue Iris - Built-in MQTT Support for motion alerts 06:05 Mikrotik Routers and Switches Support MQTT! 06:43 MQTT Explanation 07:07 MQTT Ex
posts.author: Let's Automate

posts.title: MQTT vs AMQP for IoT
posts.content: MQTT is a communication protocol designed for the Internet of Things, with publish-subscribe (pub/sub) messaging as its core. The MQTT server, also known as the broker, allows you to inspect and manage connected IoT devices and messages. AMQP is Advanced Message Queuing Protocol. Watch the video comparison of MQTT and AMQP and discover the difference between the two protocols and what is better for IoT. Head here for the full comparison article https://bit.ly/3MArrhd Timestamps: 0:00 Introduction 00:18 What is MQTT? 01:33 What is AMQP? 02:30 MQTT vs AMQP Comparison Summary 05:02 MQTT vs AMQP. Which is better for IoT? Resources: - MQTT vs AMQP Full Comparison Article https://bit.ly/3MArrhd - MQTT Essentials eBook https://bit.ly/3IMg3O7 - Learn more about HiveMQ MQTT Broker https://bit.ly/3N02uwU - Try HiveMQ Platform https://bit.ly/3ODBGDZ - IoT Protocols Comparison Video Playlist https://bit.ly/3q88j2x Music: bensound.com #MQTT #IoT #AMQP

posts.title: Radar monitoring with ESP32, MQTT and node-red
posts.content: 🚀 New project: Radar monitoring with ESP32, MQTT and node-red🚀 I am happy to share my latest technical achievement! I developed a radar system utilizing an ultrasonic sensor, an ESP32 microcontroller, a servo motor, and an MQTT broker to measure and transmit distance and angle data in real-time. In this video, you can see the radar in action, with real-time visualization of the measured data. The system is able to scan an environment and communicate the results via MQTT for remote analysis. 🔧 Technologies used: - ESP32 - MQTT - Ultrasonic sensor - Visualization Processing - Arduino IDE - Processing IDE - NODE-RED #ESP32 #Arduino #IoT #MQTT #esp32projects #ebokify
posts.author: Ebokify

posts.title: MQTT Broker Comparison for Your IoT Applications
posts.content: There are different types of MQTT brokers out there, such as open-source, commercial, cloud-managed, and general-purpose. How do you pick the right MQTT broker that fits the architectural requirements of your IoT or IIoT application? Watch this video to get a quick overview of common challenges and what to look for when choosing an MQTT broker for your IoT use case. posts.title: MQTT with ESP32 and DHT22 using Wokwi | Display on Node-Red Dashboard
posts.content: In this video, we will see how to Simulate ESP32 Integration with DHT22 with Wokwi and send the temperature and humidity values to the Node-RED Dashboard using MQTT. By the end of this video, you can see the real-time changes in Temperature and humidity of DHT22 on the Node-Red Dashboard using the MQTT publish and subscribe mechanism. 1. Setup ESP32 with DHT22 in Wokwi 2. Add the libraries needed 3. Upload the code 4. Setup the MQTT publish in code 5. Setup Node-Red 6. Create a Node-Red Dashboard to subscribe 7. View the Dashboard for the Temperature and Humidity values This can be used as IoT projects for final year students __________________________________________________________ 🔗Important links: GitHub Tutorial Link: https://github.com/Hariharnath-Paduchuru/DHT22_Esp32_MQTT_NodeRED/tree/main Wokwi Home Page: https://wokwi.com/ ESP32 Pin Layout: https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/esp32/hw-reference/esp32/get-started-devkitc.html#pin-layout Enrol in IoT Cours

posts.title: Electricity Meter Protocol to Modbus Protocol Gateways with MQTT and LoRaWAN - REDZ LKM Series
posts.content: Hello everyone, LKM Series Electricity Meter to Modbus Protocol Gateways are designed to be used with electricity meters that communicates in IEC62056-21 or P1 Companion Standard. The meters that supports IEC62056-21 and P1 Companion Standard has read out tables that has several data such as import energy, export energy, phase voltages and currents. LKM Series Electricity Meter to Modbus Protocol Gateways automatically reads that values and maps to Modbus registers. Field devices or software systems can easily read data over Modbus RTU or Modbus TCP protocol based on device model so that energy meter reading can easily be integrated to field automation systems without need of IEC6056-21 protocol or P1 Companion Standard implementation. LKM Series 868MHz LoRaWAN Meter Reader with Electricity Meter Protocol to Modbus Protocol Gateways can read IEC62056-21 Energy Meters and convert its data to Modbus Registers so that field devices or remote applications can meter data via Modbus TCP. M
posts.author: REDZ Smart Communication Technologies

posts.title: Open Automation Software MQTT Broker
posts.content: MQTT Broker for Open Automation Software to access Industry 4.0 data from third-party MQTT clients. Interface with Modbus, Allen Bradley PLCs, Siemens S7 controllers, OPC UA servers, OPC DA servers, MQTT, Sparkplug B, MTConnect, Kafka, AWS IoT Core, and databases. Data is provided in JSON payloads or as a Sparkplug B EoN. More information: https://openautomationsoftware.com/products/communications/mqtt-broker/
posts.author: Open Automation Software

posts.title: New Feature: MQTT data collector for our Data Collection Module (DCM)
posts.content: 🔊 Feature Update! 🆕 The new MQTT data collector for our Data Collection Module (DCM) allows SiteManager users to collect data from any MQTT-compatible device or data source. 🤩 Therefore, it extends your data collection options and reinforces your ability to connect Secomea with any OT equipment! 🔌 The MQTT data collector can operate in two modes. ➡️ Client mode: where it acts as an MQTT client, collecting data by subscribing to data topics on an external broker or ➡️ Broker mode: where it acts as an MQTT broker, collecting data by allowing external clients to publish data directly to the SiteManager. Both Client and Broker modes can be configured to support different authentication and TLS encryption schemes, allowing Secomea users to tailor a secure solution to collect data from their particular MQTT scenario. 🎬 Have a look at our video where our Product Owner & Embedded Software Developer, Simon Nygaard Einfeldt, describes the feature in more detail! #remoteaccess #MQTT #OT
posts.author: Secomea

posts.title: u-blox MQTT Anywhere
posts.content: MQTT Anywhere is a SIM-based communication solution supporting 2G, 3G, LTE, and LTE-M. MQTT Anywhere can be used within any type of IoT device to send and receive MQTT-SN (MQTT for sensor networks) messages. It provides an ultra-low-power, secure IoT communication service operating across 600+ cellular carriers in 190 countries around the world. Find out more here: https://www.u-blox.com/en/product/mqtt-anywhere Find answers, ask questions and connect with our community of u-blox users from around the world: https://portal.u-blox.com/s/ Check out our social media channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ublox/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/ublox?lang=en LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/company/u-blox Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ublox_/ #mqtt #lte #2G #3G #iot

posts.content: UNIT MQTT is an Ethernet MQTT communication module with an embedded ARM Cortex-M3 processor, UART communication interface (AT command control), and integrated RJ45 adaptive 10/100M network port. It also supports 4 Topics subscriptions with extremely low network latency and is widely used in various industrial automation, security monitoring systems, automatic measurement and control systems, and equipment data on the cloud. posts.title: Why use MQTT instead of HTTP in IoT applications?
posts.content: 🤖📶 Why use MQTT instead of HTTP in IoT applications? MQTT is a lightweight, efficient protocol that's designed for low-power devices and unreliable networks. It's perfect for sending small packets of data quickly and reliably, making it ideal for IoT applications. Check out our latest blog post to learn more! 🚀 #IoT #MQTT #HTTP
posts.author: CDEBYTE

posts.title: Bambu Lab Filament Tracking with MQTT – Work in Progress!
posts.content: 🚀 Tracking Bambu Lab Filament with MQTT & AMS RFID! 🎥 Managing filament inventory across multiple Bambu Lab 3D printers can be a challenge. That’s why I started working on a filament tracking system using MQTT and the RFID scanners inside the AMS. This project is still a work in progress, but I’m already capturing real-time spool data and storing it for better filament management. 🔥 What This Project Does (So Far): ✅ Uses Bambu Lab AMS RFID to identify loaded spools ✅ Captures filament data using MQTT ✅ Stores & tracks filament usage automatically ✅ Plans for web-based filament inventory tracking 🛠️ Next Steps: Improving filament usage tracking 📊 Creating a dashboard for real-time spool monitoring 💻 Automating spool stock updates 🔄 💬 Have ideas or suggestions? Let me know in the comments! 👍 If you found this interesting, hit LIKE & SUBSCRIBE for updates as I refine this system! Using: Python Ha-Bambulab's pybambu: https://github.com/greghesp/ha-bambulab/tree/main/custom_components

posts.title: Home Assistant MQTT Install and Setup - A Beginner's Guide
posts.content: MQTT and Home Assistant are extremely powerful when paired together and can be used on a wide range of applications, but what is MQTT and how does it work? How do we add it to our Home Assistant Installation? In this video I will show you how to install the Mosquitto Broker add-on in Home Assistant and install the MQTT integration so that you can be up and running with MQTT very quickly! We also discuss a MQTT topics, QoS (Quality of Service) and how to publish and subscribe as well as how to configure a Shelly smart home device with MQTT. posts.title: Shelly Pro 4PM Home Assistant, MQTT & HTTP integration (HOW-TO)
posts.content: Shelly Amazon Store - https://amzn.to/34d88VR I’m super excited, because In this video I will review one of the latest Shelly products called @Shelly_IoTPro 4PM then I will integrate it with Home Assistant and finally, I will show you how you can control the device using MQTT and HTTP. #Shelly #Pro #4PM is a Professional 4 channels relay with Wi-Fi, LAN, and Bluetooth connection, where the Bluetooth is only used during the initial inclusion and pairing. It has 4 outputs with up to 16A per output and up to 40A for the whole device. It also have several safety features like Overpower and over-voltage protection of the load as well as device temperature protection. The Shelly PRO 4PM is more than suitable for automations as it is compatible with the most used home automation platforms like Home Assistant as we will see later and allows remote control and precise power management. Shelly PRO 4PM DIN rail mountable inside a breaker box and it has a 1.8-inch color screen with navigation k

posts.title: Control an LED with MQTT & Ethernet?! | W5500-EVB-Pico2 + CircuitPython Demo
posts.content: Ever seen a light turn on just by sending a message? Watch how the W5500-EVB-Pico2 board from WIZnet uses CircuitPython + MQTT over Ethernet to control an LED — no WiFi needed! 📌 What you’ll see: Static IP setup with W5500 MQTT broker communication (Mosquitto) LED turns on/off by published messages 🚀 Perfect for IoT beginners, Python fans, and smart home builders. 🔗 Full project here: https://maker.wiznet.io/Grace_Koo/projects/circuitpython-mqtt-example-with-w5500-evb-pico2 #MQTT #CircuitPython #WIZnet #RaspberryPiPico #IoT #Shorts #Electronics #LEDControl #TechDemo #Ethernet

posts.title: Local API is Here! | MQTT x Home Assistant Integration Full Demo
posts.content: Learn how to connect Droplet to Home Assistant using Local API (via MQTT). With the latest update, Droplet now streams real-time water data directly over your local network to Home Assistant, or any MQTT-compatible smart home system. In this demo, we’ll walk you through: 🛠️ Setting up MQTT 📲 Pairing Droplet with Home Assistant via the Droplet app Update your Droplet app to version 2.8 and take full control of your water monitoring: ✅ Real-time flow rate ✅ Network connection status ✅ Signal quality received by the ultrasonic sensor 💧 Learn more about API set up: https://bit.ly/4lhinxP 🔗 Get Droplet today: https://hydrificwater.com/droplet #Droplet #HomeAssistant #MQTT #SmartHome #LocalAPI #DropletSetup #HomeAutomation
posts.author: Hydrific, part of LIXIL

posts.title: REST vs gRPC vs GraphQL vs SOAP vs WebSockets vs MQTT | Ultimate API Protocols Comparison 2025
posts.content: Confused about which API protocol to choose? In this video, we break down and compare the 6 most popular communication protocols: REST, gRPC, GraphQL, SOAP, WebSockets, and MQTT. You’ll learn: ✅ When to use each protocol ✅ Benefits and risks of each ✅ Ideal use cases for real-time apps, microservices, IoT, and more! Whether you're a frontend dev, backend engineer, or architect, this guide will help you choose the right protocol for your application needs in 2025 and beyond! Subscribe for more tech guides and architecture insights! #api #grpc #graphql #restapi #angular #webdevelopment #softwarearchitecture #mqtt #soap #websockets

posts.title: HiveMQ MQTT Client Libraries
posts.content: HiveMQ MQTT Client Libraries are designed to simplify the deployment and implementation of MQTT clients and offer users top-notch functionality, performance, security, and reliability. Programming languages supported include C#, C++, Java, Websockets, Python, and more. These client libraries are freely available, open-sourced, developed, and maintained by a dedicated team of industry experts at HiveMQ. posts.title: MQTT Brokers Explained in 60 seconds
posts.content: Curious about how your smart devices stay connected? Meet the MQTT broker-the backbone of IoT communication! In this video, we'll explain what an MQTT broker is, how it works, and why it's essential for reliable smart device messaging. Plus, learn about popular MQTT brokers like Mosquitto, HiveMQ, AWS IoT Core, and EMQX. Unlock the secrets of seamless IoT communication today! Learn how MQTT brokers work and discover the top picks like EMQX, Mosquitto, and HiveMQ in this video. Explore the world of IoT and AWS IoT Core with MQTT protocol and make the right choice for your projects. #mqtt #mqttessentials #mosquitto #hivemq #emqx
